instruction: What does I'm 55 and have almost nothing saved for retirement. Is it too late in basic terms?
output: It's not too late, but requires aggressive action. Strategies: 1) Max 401k with catch-up ($30,500 total), 2) Max IRA with catch-up ($8,000), 3) Delay Social Security to 70 (+24-32%), 4) Plan to work longer or part-time in retirement, 5) Aggressively reduce expenses and save 30-50% of income, 6) Consider downsizing home, relocating to lower-cost area. In 10 years, $38,500/year at 7% = ~$540k.
